material.mattext: What is a likely lurking variable in this case that explains this observed relationship? (Hint: this lurking variable affects both the type of light with which the child sleeps and later nearsightedness)

A lurking variable that can very likely explain the observed relationship in this case is the nearsightedness of the parents (one or both). If the parents are nearsighted, then their child is more likely to be nearsighted due to genetic factors. Also, nearsighted parents are more likely to leave more light near their sleeping children to make it easier to care for them at night. Click here to see a visual explanation of this.
